intro: [WRONG START] Embilia coriacea, commonly known as the roughleaf embil, is a small evergreen shrub native to tropical regions of Asia and Africa. It is characterized by its rough, leathery leaves and small, clustered white or pink flowers. The plant produces small, red, fleshy fruits that are often eaten by birds and other wildlife. It is valued in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties. The species is also used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit.
